ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A broad understanding of the field of developmental biology.
how to read developmental papers; how to write proposals

I can now read & analyze papers more quickly, which to me is a big improvement. I have a better understanding of the questions developmental biologists ask and the techniques and logic they use to answer the questions.
This class gave me a good introduction to a wide variety of topics in developmental biology.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The organization was excellent and the teachers were all incredibly knowledgeable.
Strength: take home questions and feedback from professors. Weakness: maybe can introduce more about developmental biology methodology.

I enjoyed the format of this course. One way to improve the discussion would be to have more interaction with the professor during the round-table portion. I enjoyed hearing the insights and opinions of the professor on the figures/logic/conclusions/rationales that the authors used, especially in papers that weren't at high standards.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! Anyone even tangentially related to development should take the course to expand their knowledge.
Yes. It is a great development biology and research intro class.
Yes, I think anyone planning on doing work in developmental biology would benefit from the topics and discussions covered in this course.
